website_summaries.verdict: The very secure-fitting Yamaha EPH-M100 earphones offer deep bass response, but could use more definition in the high-mids.
pros: Powerful audio performance with deep bass response
Very secure fit with five sets of eartips
cons: Can sound less crisp and defined than it should

customer_reviews.title: Okay sound, aesthetically pleasing, flimsy cord, not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I've had these for a little over a month, and I'm generally disappointed. I had a pair of Yamaha eph-50s in the past that I loved so when I needed some new earbuds I thought I'd try these. Overall I'm disappointed in them. They have decent sound quality, but not much better than a $10 pair you could get anywhere. I love the design of the buds themselves and the in-line control, they're both very good looking. My biggest issue is that the cord itself is INSANELY FLIMSY. I feel like I'm going to break it just pushing it aside. The Jack also seems pretty shoddy too. Overall an okay pair of headphones not worth close to the price tag.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not durable at all.
customer_reviews.text: Great sound and very crisp, great noise cancellation, not the best for heavy bass though. They are much more emphasized with higher notes and I had to up the lows on my equalizer to even it out. Overall beautiful sound quality and I enjoyed using these. Unfortunately, the cord is not durable at all and I feared from the moment I first opened up these earbuds that the thin flimsy cord wouldn't last. Today after two months of everyday use they have stopped working in one ear. Severely disappointed as it's the most I've personally chosen to spend on earbuds and it was kind of a luxury item for me (low income household)
customer_reviews.author: Larissa Frederickson

customer_reviews.title: Huge Bass....!!!
customer_reviews.text: i dont agree with the reviewers saying that is has subtle/gentle base. the base is high level...! its good, but a little bit dominating the sound production. i listen to it using iPhone. the only equalizer i set is "Reduce bass" and the result is awesome...! i am going back and forth to say that the build is cheap. it feel really placticy but it makes it really light. so i guess i don't have a problem with that. i purchased this at $60 which i think how it really worth.
customer_reviews.author: Abdullah Nurhasan

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Buds
customer_reviews.text: Christmas present! Great audio separation and clarity, perfect mids/highs; bass could be a tad more 'punchier' but is quite adequate. Probably best for jazz and blues, however rock and pop music still sounds great! Will expose the flaws in less than cd quality audio. Design of earbuds does require getting used to. I found pushing on the circle going in the ear canal and pushing the bottom of the earbud right to the bottom of your ear lobe works great. A superb deal for under $100! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Earphones
customer_reviews.text: This are really great earphones. You hear all the music. They fit well in your ear so you hear all the bass, midrange, and treble. Replace those free earphones you get, or replace those cheap $20 earphones for these. You'll be glad you did. These are quality earphones!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful earbuds for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I have enjoyed these earbuds. I use them at my desk while working. The fit is much less intrusive than other earbuds I have used. Microphone, play/pause and volume up/down are a nice addition. I must add that the sound quality is exceptional for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Buckley

customer_reviews.title: Excellent earphones - totally worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Great bass, great sound clarity. These headphones are great but the way to accentuate the effect is to play around with the equalizer settings on your phone. This is one of those rare ear phones which actually magnifies the equalizer effect. I love my Bose over the ear headphones but Yamaha earphones are simply far superior. Is it worth the $60 - absolutely yes!
customer_reviews.author: Leo

customer_reviews.title: Sound great, great sound isolation
customer_reviews.text: I've had these a couple years now, and I still use them today! They have great sound for the price point and for being earbuds, and they do a great job of isolating sound.
customer_reviews.author: K. Kahle

customer_reviews.title: Yamaha has the best earbuds.
customer_reviews.text: I had to get a replacements. Decides to go with this model. They sound quality is excellent. I personally recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value
customer_reviews.text: They sound & fit great. Comes with multiple in-ear fitment pieces. I could get the sound I wanted with the "EQ" settings on my iphone 6.
customer_reviews.author: Kat and Mikey

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great all around sound. One the best in its class.
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey C.

customer_reviews.title: Rich Bass, Wonderful Highs and Power-Handling
customer_reviews.text: For the value and he pricepoint; excellent power-handling, rich bass punch, wonderful highs... Can out-do any Bose in-ear model and has similar performances to my Monster Lil-Jamz and iSport Victory headsets.
customer_reviews.author: MIKEDJ2

customer_reviews.title: Great sound but problematic design
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic crisp sound with just enough bass. Great fit for working out. BUT 15 months in and the goofy L-shaped jack has a short. It's been yanked a handful of times do to my iPhone falling outta my pocket during sit-ups, and it just hasn't held up. The jack design is a harsh task master for any mistakes. Poor quality or weak design.
customer_reviews.author: brian thompson

customer_reviews.title: Great sounding headphones even at high volume
customer_reviews.text: Great sounding headphones even at high volume. The bass and treble flows perfectly and one does not overwhelm the other.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Newman

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great earphones!!! Love the sound quality, much better than the earphones I have had from Bose, Klipsch, Phiaton, etc.
customer_reviews.author: NB3

customer_reviews.title: Costly for the quality
customer_reviews.text: Microphone makes noise..... Not that durable wires....you always get the feeling they might break sound quality is ok ok type.
customer_reviews.author: varun

customer_reviews.title: Sounds awful.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what everyone is talking about, to me the sound seemed muffled and not clear. Plus the design is bulky and uncomfortable. I regret buying it but whatever, I don't know why i decided to try something new and more expensive. The Philips SHQ2305WS was perfect for me in term of sound quality and much less expensive. but unfortunately it broke down after almost a year but i was pretty tough on it not gonna lie.
customer_reviews.author: Reb

customer_reviews.title: Not a substitute for the EPH-100sl
customer_reviews.text: I bought these thinking they might be an update to the EPH-100SL which is my favorite in ear headphone, but suffers from the left headphone not always working. These headphones didn't provide anywhere near the clarity/level of detail to music as the EPH-100SL line does. They did have decent bass and seemed comfortable to wear. However, the overall poor sound quality left me considering these a significant disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Erik B

product_meta.title: Yamaha EPH-M100BU High-Performance Earphones with Remote and Mic, Blue
product_meta.description: Color:Blue| Product Packaging:Standard PackagingEmploying large-caliber drivers, these in-ear headphones deliver full-range sound with powerful bass, clear mids and crisp, sparkling highs. A lightweight, ergonomic design provides an ultra-comfortable fit and a tangle-resistant cable offers a built-in remote/mic that puts control at your fingertips.
feature_bullets: Outstanding clarity, detail and tonal accuracy
Large-caliber dynamic drivers for powerful, precise bass
Five ear tip sizes for custom fit with excellent noise-isolation
Tangle-resistant cable with remote and mic
Carrying case included; Connectivity Technology: Wired

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars33 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
